evidence: Clear module separation with distinct packages (connections, fuzzers, mutants, loggers, monitors, etc.)
Each module has well-defined interfaces and abstract base classes (IFuzzer, IMonitor, ITargetConnection)
High cohesion within packages - mutants package contains all mutation-related classes
Low coupling between modules through interface abstractions
Consistent use of __init__.py files indicating intentional module organization
Package depth of 4 levels suggests thoughtful architectural decomposition
Average fan-out of 2.85 indicates moderate inter-module dependencies
Extensive use of inheritance and abstract base classes for extension points
risks: Some modules like 'fuzzers' contain protocol-specific implementations that could benefit from further decoupling
High number of packages (21) might indicate some modules could be consolidated
Maintainability index shows variation (25.98 min to 79.02 avg) suggesting some modules may be overly complex
